meanings.sent1: She was gagging on the large piece of food.
meanings.sent2: The smell of the rotten food had her gagging uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's silly face had the audience gagging with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The pungent odor from the garbage can had her gagging as if it were a toxic gas.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the slimy creature had her gagging in disgust.

meanings.definition: Preventing speech by putting something in the mouth
meanings.sent1: The kidnapper used a gagging device to keep the victim silent.
meanings.sent2: The gagging of the witness was a clear attempt to stop the truth from being revealed.
meanings.sent3: The playful child used a piece of cloth as a gagging tool during their game of pretend.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the library felt like a heavy gagging on all the noise.
meanings.sent5: The gagging of the protester's voice only fueled their determination to be heard.

meanings.definition: Making a joke or humorous remark
meanings.sent1: His gagging comment lightened the mood in the room.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's gagging tone had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent3: The gagging pun caught everyone off guard with its cleverness.
meanings.sent4: Her gagging wit was always appreciated during tense moments.
